title.narrative: National -Lund-KTH Univ -Sust fishing in Colombia Open Innovation- 2020-2023
National -Lund-KTH Univ-Hållbart fiske genom Öppen Innovation Colombia 2020-2023

description.narrative: The general objective of the contribution is “to strength and develop communitarian ecosystem capabilities and self-efficacy by designing a sustainable fishing model under open innovation and co-creation methodologies that contributes to reducing the environmental and economic impact generated by the current fossil fuel system”. It is expected that through the development of this project, a more dynamic economy and greater investment from the private and public sectors will lead, in the long term, to an improvement in the quality of life for people living in the municipality of Guapi. It is also expected to stimulate other related initiatives that contribute to the development of artisanal fishing in sustainable terms, such as tourism. The specific proposed outputs are -To develop a sustainable model associated with to the artisanal fishing value chain in Guapi through identifying socioeconomic and environmental factors of the ecosystem. -To design and build a boat powered by renewable and hybrid energies in coordination with the designed sustainable fishing model. - To propose a business plan in coordination with social entrepreneurships, strengthening the proposed sustainable fishing model.

Insatsens övergripande mål är att "stärka och utveckla lokalsamhällets gemensamma kapacitet och egenförmåga för ekosystem genom utformningen av en hållbar fiskerimodell, med stöd av innovation och medskapande metoder för minskning av miljö- och ekonomisk påverkan som det nuvarande systemet för fossila bränslen ger upphov till". Det svenska bidraget på 6 110 000 SEK delas upp enligt följande: 5 600 000 SEK till Colombias nationella universitet (UNAL), 270 000 SEK till Lunds universitet och 240 000 SEK till KTH, Kungliga Tekniska Högskolan.

The general objective of the contribution is “to strengthen and develop communitarian ecosystem capabilities and self-efficacy by designing a sustainable fishing model under open innovation and co-creation methodologies that contributes to reducing the environmental and economic impact generated by the current fossil fuel system”. The Swedish contribution of 6,110,000 SEK will be divided as follows: 5,600,000 SEK for the National University of Colombia (UNAL), 270,000 SEK for Lund University and 240,000 SEK for KTH, the Royal Institute of Technology.

tag.narrative: 14.4 - By 2020, effectively regulate harvesting and end overfishing, illegal, unreported and unregulated fishing and destructive fishing practices and implement science-based management plans, in order to restore fish stocks in the shortest time feasible, at least to levels that can produce maximum sustainable yield as determined by their biological characteristics.

14.4 - Senast 2020 införa en effektiv fångstreglering och stoppa överfiske, olagligt, orapporterat och oreglerat fiske liksom destruktiva fiskemetoder samt genomföra vetenskapligt baserade förvaltningsplaner i syfte att återställa fiskbestånden så snabbt som möjligt, åtminstone till de nivåer som kan producera maximalt hållbart uttag, fastställt utifrån deras biologiska egenskaper.

7.a - By 2030, enhance international cooperation to facilitate access to clean energy research and technology, including renewable energy, energy efficiency and advanced and cleaner fossil-fuel technology, and promote investment in energy infrastructure and clean energy technology.

7.a - Till 2030 stärka det internationella samarbetet för att underlätta tillgång till forskning och teknik inom ren energi, inklusive förnybar energi, energieffektivitet samt avancerad och renare fossilbränslebaserad teknik, samt främja investeringar i energiinfrastruktur och ren energiteknik.

title.narrative: Agreeement KTH - PPDP Sustainable fishing through open innovation
Agreeement Lund University- PPDP Sustainable fishing through open innovation
Agreement- PPDP Sustainable fishing through open innovation
Decision on contribution- 12745- PPDP Sustainable fishing through open innovation

description.narrative:
In 2021 the whole academic team was hired and three field trips were undertaken to develop the first outcome of developing a sustainable model linked to the artisanal fishing value chain in Guapi. The main activities in partnership with the participants fishing organizations for diagnosis of the socioeconomic and biological condition of fishing activity in Guapi and the analysis of the fishing value chain were developed. The social team conducted a gender analysis, to understand the role of women in the artisanal fishing activities.
For the second outcome of designing and building a boat powered by renewable and hybrid energies linked to the designed sustainable fishing model UNAL could only complete the workshop that focused on design thinking. The design team has, in cooperation with the communities and based on social cartography, created a logotype of the project that could also be used by the associations in the future. The engineering team prepared a complete report on the energy generation alternatives for the boat, hybrid solutions and proposed preliminary social, economic and technical criteria for choosing the best solution. None of the activities for the third outcome of proposing a business plan linked to social entrepreneurships were implemented during the first year but the plan is to develop them in the second half of 2022.
In addition, as part of the Bogota International Bookfair, where Sweden was the guest of honour, this project was presented in a virtual event on August the 20th, 2021. Catalina Hoyos from the Embassy moderated the panel discussion where Professors Katarina Larssen from KTH, Marie Löwegren from Lund University, Diana Lopez from the National University (UNAL), and Sebastian Loango, Representative of the Renacer Guapireño Association presented the projects goals, results, challenges and their different roles as a good example of triple helix and open innovation. Here is a link to the published material from KTH: https://www.kth.se/philhist/historia/kalender/webinar-co-creation-in-t
The Embassy's assessment is that use of the participatory approach was an important element of the open innovation and co-creation perspectives, as well as the promotion of participant communities and the academic teams ownership. The design team included didactic communication elements for the common understanding of the project objectives that emphasized the teamwork, creativity, common learning process and common leadership. During the second half of the year, the Embassy also participated in 8 virtual meetings where the different academic teams presented their progress on: gender issues; ethnography; oceanography and the environment; design; value chain; and design and power system of the boat. Hence, the first year has been useful to consolidate the team with common recognition of the contributions from different disciplines as well as from the traditional fishing practices.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
